Sentencas: In this paper, a ceramic perovskite anode for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) is prepared by infiltrating La and Fe co-doped strontium titanium, La0.3Sr0.7Ti0.3Fe0.7O3-delta (LSTF0.7) into porous backbone of scandia-stabilized zirconia (ScSZ) and tested in pure H-2 at 700-850 C-omicron.
Titulo: Catalytic activity improvement for efficient hydrogen oxidation of infiltrated La0.3Sr0.7Ti0.3Fe0.7O3-δ anode for solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: LSTF0.7 crystal exhibits high reduction stability and good compatibility with ScSZ electrolyte under reducing atmosphere.
Titulo: Catalytic activity improvement for efficient hydrogen oxidation of infiltrated La0.3Sr0.7Ti0.3Fe0.7O3-δ anode for solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: In order to improve the electrocatalytic activity, 15 wt% of CeO2 and 7 wt% of Ni are infiltrated into the backbone pores respectively, thus forming LSTF0.7-CeO2 and Ni-CeO2-LSTF0.7 composite anodes.
Titulo: Catalytic activity improvement for efficient hydrogen oxidation of infiltrated La0.3Sr0.7Ti0.3Fe0.7O3-δ anode for solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The cell with LSTF0.7 single anode shows a relatively lower maximal power density (MPD) of 401 mW cm(-2) in H-2 at 800 C-omicron.
Titulo: Catalytic activity improvement for efficient hydrogen oxidation of infiltrated La0.3Sr0.7Ti0.3Fe0.7O3-δ anode for solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: While the maximal power densities of the cells with LSTF0.7-CeO2 and Ni-CeO2-LSTF0.7 composite anodes are 612 mW cm(-2) and 698 mW cm(-2) operated at the same conditions, respectively.
Titulo: Catalytic activity improvement for efficient hydrogen oxidation of infiltrated La0.3Sr0.7Ti0.3Fe0.7O3-δ anode for solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The three anode polarization resistances (Rp,a) distinguished from the corresponding full cells are 0.176, 0.086 and 0.076 Omega cm(2) at 800 C-omicron, respectively.
Titulo: Catalytic activity improvement for efficient hydrogen oxidation of infiltrated La0.3Sr0.7Ti0.3Fe0.7O3-δ anode for solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The values of the activation energy (Ea) towards H-2 oxidation for the three anodes can be calculated to be 52.2, 46.0, 43.9 kJ mol(-1) based on their respective Rp,a. Therefore, the LSTF0.7-based anodes are considered to be promising alternatives for solid oxide fuel cell applications.
Titulo: Catalytic activity improvement for efficient hydrogen oxidation of infiltrated La0.3Sr0.7Ti0.3Fe0.7O3-δ anode for solid oxide fuel cell
